title: eValue project (+ ASTE)

author: Adrian Zlocki, Institut für Kraftfahrwesen Aachen

segmentation: First of all, this slight correction.
I'm not talking about the ESA projects is not the main topic.
I will mention the ask the project and the results of this project, but the focus of my presentation is the value project is the project on testing and evaluation methods for ICT based systems.
This is a project and you project project in the 7th Framework.
And so, let me give you in the beginning a short introduction into the project with some.
With some figures, the overall budget of the project is more or less 3.7 million euros, whereas 2.3 million euros are funded by the European Commission.
The project kicked off in the beginning of this year in January, and it will last for three years, so the project will be over by the end of 2010.
We have seven partners within the framework of the project, thesis SP from Sweden, VTi.
VTech IATA technical technology are robotica, EBONCRF and last but not least I K where I am from.
IK is also coordinating the project.
It's done by my colleague.
Michelle is a man.
So he's the coordinator of the project to give you a short overview of where the partners are located.
We have two partners from Spain, Robotica and IATA.
We have a partner from Italy with CRF with three partners from Sweden, Volvo V Tech and SP and two partners from Germany.
The sensor supply eBay landos the IK so we have more or less 2 original equipment manufacturer within the console.
Zoom.
The goals and objectives of the value.
R2 develop test methods for ICT based systems and thereby we tried to.
The goal is to increase the public awareness and the customer acceptance of the ICT based systems.
So we want to bring the customers.
Closer how such systems help to reduce the accidents may be, and how these systems can be rated.
With that.
With that we also try to support the development process, maybe for the manufacturers, but how can we reach those objectives?
So because the value didn't start from scratch, and now I'd like to talk very briefly about the Aster study.
I do have some.

Problems with the point in here, as you see, the focus of the author study is to try to have a feasibility study for setting up a performance testing program for ICT based safety systems for Rd transport and the aim of the study was to check if it's feasible to set up an independent performance testing program.
With that they try to have a look.
Also trying to calculate.
Things and try to find out if it's feasible economically.
They also try to find out if it's feasible by talking to all the stakeholders.
For example, manufacturers, customers and people who actually do perform the testing.
And with that after try to come up with needed methods and principles on how these systems can be tested.
And often in the end of the program of this study they tried to propose or the proposed.
Principles on how this testing could be done.
Partners of the US study were Sweden partners Linkhorn, Science Park, Volvo Car Corporation, Volvo Technology SP.
And VTi.
And let's give give you some results of the study.
In total, the overall approach is shown here on this slide slide.
This is the continuous loop of performance.
How to access an improve test methods, how to adapt to test methods to new technologies, and how to validate the effects for safety system.
And with that in this approach, ask to came up with more or less 3 three system's performance testing scenarios.
The first one is the system based.
Performance testing, which you can do here.
You check you have to system which is included in the vehicle and you test against the system and with that you can more or less answer the question if the specification of the supplier is fulfilled.
The advantages of such an approach is that your test cases are more or less limited and you only test for one particular system.
For example ACC.
You can test it by different suppliers.
Disadvantages of such an approach?
Are that you can only assess the benefit of 1 special special function.
And of course we cannot decide where are the thresholds.
Huawei is an ACC from manufacturer one worse than an AC system for manufacturer too.
Of course, maybe the design of this is to see my very the ones more supportive.
The other one is more focused on safety, so we cannot do.
Wrestles a second approach is the scenario based testing.
Here we have a harmonization of test methods.
We can test overall the overall vehicle.
And not only a single system and we can take into account all these systems which are into built into the vehicle.
This is very easy to communicate to the stakeholders, especially to the customers because we can rate a vehicle not only one system and this is more.

There are some more correlation to real life because in real life accidents or real life dangerous situations you have the whole vehicle with you and not just only one system which you rely on the drawbacks of.
A scenario based performance testing is of course that you need many scenarios to test all the different systems which might be available or which are available.
And of course the question key question is how to create such scenarios.
Where do we derive those scenarios for?
Foot Third Approach is the document based testing.
This is only a testing which answers ask the question on Augusta system actually do what it provides, what is what it promises is the system plausable.
This is a very theoretical approach and of course you need only limited resources.

You don't need the actual real world testing for the document based performance testing but in the end the results are only on theoretical basis and therefore maybe there are some drawbacks to those results.

The conclusion of the Astor study is that's the most feasable testing is the scenario based testing where you come up with scenarios and there for us to came up with a couple of scenarios which I would like to name.
It's the forward collision scenario, the rear end collision scenario, the crossing collision scenario and the overtaking scenario.
And last but not least, the single vehicle accident.
I'm concluding the results of the Esther study is, after many calculations have been done, which I don't want to present here because they are more or less only figures.
But the performance or testing is technically and economically feasible.
Therefore vehicle active safety performance shall be tested and shall be tested in a system based traffic scenarios.
The Performance test results must be possible to communicate in a very simple way.
Very similar to the Stars.
For example, in the Euro encap procedure and it is possible to have conclusion between different stakeholders.
They talked a lot to customers to manufacturers and to people who actually perform the testing and that's.

But they concluded, coming back to Evalue, let's have a look here at the objectives once again of the value compared to Euro, encap Evalue focuses more on the active safety systems which help to prevent the accidents.
So which are?
Systems which detect potential hazards and which help to avoid those hazards.
Some examples are given here.
ACC Lane departure warning a BS you see for example.

Evalue would like to take all the stakeholders also into account, so people like me who performed the actual testing the researches and developments at these suppliers at the manufacturers who develop new safety systems and the customers we try also to rise.
Then the customer awareness by maybe for example also having later on at this stage not within the frame of the project, but maybe later on another project.
For example, a star system or another rate.
System.
To summarize what we want to do is we will would like to define objective elevation and test methods and performance criteria.
We like to build defective standards.
We try to regard current and upcoming active safety systems and we like to consider system interaction and system integration.
We would in within the framework of this project we would like to also test those systems chosen systems which I will talk about in a.
Next slide and we will like to support those test by simulations.
We would like to communicate these results and the test methodology to the stakeholders, the OEM suppliers and so on.
And last but not least, the focus is to raise the public awareness of the topic of active safety systems.
What we do not want to do in this project is we don't want to give direct summarization of testings.
And we do not want to define pass or fail criteria of systems which are from.
Different manufacturers, therefore we started with a road map to have an overview of all the active safety systems which are available today and maybe in the future.
You see here a timeline.

Those are the systems in the inner circle which are available today, and if you go out to the outer circles, those are future systems which will be introduced in the next couple of years up to 10 years and we have more or less for class of those systems and four domains domains.
This is the long internal SS.
Assistance domain electoral Assistance Maine the jaw stability main and an addition.
No domain.

And from those four domains we derived, or we picked four systems in four different systems from each domain and total the threatens for those systems were were that they are available in the market today with a high penetration rate that they are active safety systems which help to prevent an accident, and they must be of one of those four domain we came up with the systems ACC forward collision warning collision mitigation by breaking from the longitudinal assistance domain.

With blind spot detection, Lane departure warning and Lane keeping assistance from the lateral assistance domain and a BS ESC from the jaw stability domain from the 4th domain, we didn't pick a system so far because we would like to leave this open until a point in the project where we have to choose a system, but up to that point we would like to see how the further developments are within the automotive word, so maybe there's a new system coming up by the end of this year and then we can also regard their system.
Within the project.
Last but not least, I would like to show you this general approach and how we would like to develop those test methods in the next few months and years.
We would like to start to chose the relevant scenarios.
Maybe we can base them on accident accident data if it's available or also from project results.
I have written down here as examples the trace or prevent project.
Or maybe we can derive those scenarios from testing procedures which are already available today from manufacturers from suppliers from test facilities or from expert knowledge.
And with that we also.
Then we would like to develop our test and evaluation methods on the other side we also will have a look at the systems which we picked before at the state of the art.
We will do a system verification and validation and with that we would like in the end then conclude anhava.
Safety impact and see how good those sis.
Act with that.
I'd like to thank you for your attention.
If you are interested, you can talk to me anytime here in my contact details, but we also set up.
Of course, the web page.
It's www.evalueminusproject.euthewebpage is up and running and it will be filled with information.

There is already some information on there, but of course in the next few months and more information is coming up and there you will also find the contact details to Mitchell is a man who is the coordinator of the project.
Thank you very much.
